title: 2017 KTM Duke 390: Everything you need to know : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
text:
2017 KTM Duke 390: Everything you need to know IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, February 21, 2017 | Written by Pratik Rakshit | UPDATED 15:58 IST The new 390 Duke will compete against the likes of DSK Benelli TNT 25, Mahindra Mojo, Honda CBR 250R and Bajaj Dominar 400 in India. 
KTM is all set to launch the new 390 Duke in India on February 23. KTM had unveiled the new generation KTM Duke 390 at the EICMA 2016 and the entire KTM range is manufactured at Bajaj Auto's Chakan plant in Pune. While the KTM Duke 390 will be a completely new bike, deliveries will commence from March 2017. 
But, before the launch of the new KTM 390 Duke, we tell you what the new KTM 390 Duke has to offer. 
Price: 
We expect the new Duke 390 to come for a price of Rs 2.5 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi)- Rs 5 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi). 2017 KTM 390 Duke 
Design: 
The all new KTM Duke 390 will come with a new bolt-on rear subframe, a larger steel tank and steeply rising lines that catapult their street cred sky-high. The 2017 Duke 390 also receive a high-tech TFT display, an LED headlight and the best brakes in their segment. 
Engine: 
The 2017 KTM Duke 390 will come with a 373.2cc, 1-cylinder, 4-stroke Liquid cooled engine that churns out peak power at 42HP and peak torque of 37 Nm, mated to a six-speed transmission. The engine will be BS-IV compliant. 2017 KTM 390 Duke 
Features: 
The new KTM Duke 390 will come loaded with features like LED DRL, LED headlight, LED taillight, Colour TFT instrument panel and KTM MY RIDE for smartphone tethering. 
Competition: 
The new 390 Duke will compete against the likes of DSK Benelli TNT 25, Mahindra Mojo, Honda CBR 250R and Bajaj Dominar 400 in India.
